name: Sharon Hessney
comment info:
When should you use "number" and when should use "amount?"  

Number is used when you can count the items – number of refugees, number of graphs, etc.

Amount is used when you can’t count the items – amount of firepower, amount of peace, etc.

Using the correct word makes your writing clearer and is what is used by the New York Times.

We notice...
 *Venezuela has the highest number, but Ukraine has the faster rate and the number will likely surpass the Venezuela's total.
